questions.question: How did the Hebrews initially get to Egypt?

choices.answer: they went for food and found Joseph working for the Pharaoh
God lead them to Egypt, the promised land
They lived there since the Earth had been flooded
They lived there from the time of Abraham and circumcision

questions.question: Why was Moses hunted from birth?

choices.answer: Moses' family wouldn't follow Pharaoh's religion
Pharaoh ordered all newborn Hebrew boys be drowned.
It was a policy from Pharaoh's father
Moses' father was a wanted man

questions.question: God’s providence was at work in the early life of Moses. How did God save Moses as a baby?

choices.answer: Pharaoh rescued him when he saw Moses struggle in the water
"Moses" means drawn from the water
Moses escaped and hid out, disguised as an Egyptian
Pharaoh’s daughter saved him from the water.

questions.question: Why did Moses kill someone?

choices.answer: Moses was framed by Pharaoh's jealous son
When Moses saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew slave he killed
Moses killed the Hebrew for being a terrible slave
Moses was trying to kill Pharaoh but killed the wrong man

questions.question: What sign did God use when appearing to Moses?

choices.answer: in the plagues
in a goat's voice
in a burning bush
He spoke through the Pharaoh

questions.question: What did Moses have to do because he was on holy ground?

choices.answer: bow down to God
remove his sandals
become circumcized
shave his head

questions.question: What did God tell Moses to reply when the Israelites asked who sent him?

choices.answer: I am who I am
I am who you want to be
I am all that I am
“I am who am”

questions.question: What excuse did Moses give to God?

choices.answer: That he was a slow speaker (stuttered)
That he didn't want to leave his family
That he couldn't afford the trip
That he couldn't get behind God's message

questions.question: What jobs did Moses have?

choices.answer: get Pharaoh to let them go, get the people, get out
get Pharaoh to let them go and leave quickly
get the people out, sneaking at night
convert the people to become Catholic before the trip

questions.question: How did God help Moses overcome his fear concerning his inability to speak well?

choices.answer: God told him that his speech was fine
God gave Moses more courage
God let Aaron speak for Moses
God cured Moses' speech problem

questions.question: What finally convinced Pharaoh that he should allow the Israelites to leave Egypt?

choices.answer: The death of Pharaoh’s eldest son. (10th plague)
The people rebelled and forced Pharaoh from the throne
The Pharaoh never changed his mind
The flies drove him nuts

questions.question: What special preparation did the Israelites have to make for the night of their departure?

choices.answer: smear the blood of the oldest son over the Egyptian's homes
Had to quietly sneak away so they wouldn't be caught
eat a sacrificed lamb and smear the blood around the door
eat a live cow and smear the blood on the firstborn son

questions.question: How did God help the Israelites on their way out of Egypt?

choices.answer: column of cloud in daytime and a column of fire at night.
column of cloud in daytime and a column of smoke at night.
column of cloud in daytime and a column of dust at night.
column of cloud in daytime and a column of water at night.

questions.question: What kind of slavery does Jesus save us from?

choices.answer: Jesus saves us from the slavery of free will
Jesus saves us from the slavery of jealousy
Jesus saves us from the slavery of sin
Jesus saves us from the slavery of coveting

questions.question: Why did the Israelites need to use unleavened bread?

choices.answer: There was a huge yeast shortage
Pharaoh's people stole their grain
had to be ready and did not have time to let the bread rise
they forgot to make the bread earlier in the day

questions.question: What do the bitter herbs symbolize?

choices.answer: They are a reminder of the bitter times suffered in Egypt
the bitter journey out of Egypt
the bitter years they would wander in the desert
the bitterness represented slavery

questions.question: The Hebrew word for seder means?

choices.answer: praise to Yahweh
house of God
“order of service”

questions.question: When do we celebrate Jesus’ freeing us from the slavery of sin?

choices.answer: every time we read the bible
every time we pray to God
at every Mass

questions.question: Why didn’t Moses lead the people by the most direct route?

choices.answer: to punish them for not leaving Egypt earlier
God was leading them away from wars and enemies
to lead them where there was a lot of food and water

questions.question: After the Israelites left Egypt, they began to complain. Why did the regret leaving Egypt?

choices.answer: food and water were scarce and the people were afraid
they hated Moses and his leadership
they were not unhappy in Egypt and missed it there

questions.question: What was wrong with the water at Marah?

choices.answer: was very salty
was very bitter
was very sweet
was very rotten

questions.question: How did the water become fresh?

choices.answer: Moses threw a piece of wood into the water to make it fresh.
Moses threw a rock into it to make it fresh
Moses threw a staff at it to make it fresh
Moses blessed it to make it fresh

questions.question: What did the people have to learn about God’s care for them?

choices.answer: food and water would always be there for them
That God would care for them if they made sacrifices
That God would provide for them when they were good
trust God to care for them even in impossible situations.

questions.question: What three things did God give to the Israelites during their journey?

choices.answer: wood, food, rain
shelter, fire, water
manna, quail, fresh water
courage, strength, stamina

questions.question: What was God’s new covenant with the people?

choices.answer: circumcision
a set of rules for the chosen people
flood/rainbow
Himself

questions.question: When Moses told the people God’s plan, what did they answer?

choices.answer: “Everything the Lord has said, we will do”
“Everything the Lord has said, we will try to do”
“Everything the Lord has said, we will think about"
“Everything the Lord has said, is His will"

questions.question: How did the people seal their covenant with God?

choices.answer: the people prayed at Mt. Morah for three days
the people had a feast and celebration
Moses sprinkled animal blood on the altar and on the people
the people held another passpover

questions.question: What was kept in the Ark of the Covenant?

choices.answer: the sacrificial lamb
the chalice
burnt offerings
10 Commandments

questions.question: Where was the Ark housed?

choices.answer: inside the temple
Tent of the meeting
inside the walls of the city
at the side of the mountain

questions.question: What sin did the Israelites fall into while Moses was on the mountain?

choices.answer: idolatry (worshiping something other than God)
ignored Moses and left town
ignored what God said and started coveting
they started taking things that were not theirs

questions.question: How did the people worship idols?

choices.answer: they made a golden calf and worshiped when Moses was gone
they made a statute of Moses and worshiped it instead of God
they made a temple for Pharaoh while Moses was on the mt.
they decided not to believe in God

questions.question: What did God expect from His chosen people?

choices.answer: God expected His people to love all gods
God expected obedience to His law
God expected his people to still love Pharaoh
God expected his people to not use free will

questions.question: What did God do after the people broke the Covenant and practiced idolatry?

choices.answer: God forgave them but broke the covenant
God forgave them and replaced the tablets
God was angry and tried to kill them
God was furious and disowned them

questions.question: Summarize all the commandments in one word:

choices.answer: FAITH
HOPE
LOVE
WORSHIP

questions.question: How did the scouts describe the land of Canaan?

choices.answer: the land was wonderful, people were fierce
the land was firece, people were wonderful
the land was wild, people were gentle
the land was wooded, people were savage

questions.question: Why were Joshua and Caleb ready to march on Canaan?

choices.answer: God told them it would be victorious
they had faith that God would be with them bring victory
they spoke with God who told them to go anyway
they saw a vision of the victory in the future

questions.question: What decision did the Israelites make?

choices.answer: not to march against Canaan
to march against Canaan
to stay and set up camp at Mt. Morah
to go to Midian

questions.question: Once they made that decision, God became angry. Why?

choices.answer: God was done forgiving the people over and over
He got tired to the complaining
Was insulted by the lack of trust in Him the Israelites had
God was waiting for them to do His will

questions.question: How did God show His displeasure with the people?

choices.answer: God stopped providing manna
God said people would be struck with sickness and disowned
God kicked the people out of ever being able to enter Heaven
God forbid the people from knowing Jesus

questions.question: Why did God forgive them?

choices.answer: He is a loving, forgiving God
He knows all and knows that people will change and be good
He is always willing to forgive when we are sorry
He will provide a second chance but not a third

questions.question: What did the Israelites suffer because of their sin?

choices.answer: they would wander the wilderness for 4000 years
they would wander the wilderness for 4 years
they would wander the wilderness for 400 years
they would wander the wilderness for 40 years

questions.question: Who would live to enter Canaan?

choices.answer: Moses, Aaron, Caleb
Caleb, Joshua, and some young children
Moses, Caleb, Joshua
Caleb, Joshua, Aaron

questions.question: Why did God feel that Moses showed a lack of faith?

choices.answer: Moses didn't strike the rock
Moses struck the rock twice
Moses struck the rock once
Moses told his people striking the rock wouldn't work

questions.question: What was Moses' punishment?

choices.answer: God disowned him
He wouldn't travel any further with them
He wouldn't enter Heaven
He wouldn't enter Canaan

questions.question: When is Mrs. Dellasega's birthday?

choices.answer: FEB 20
FEB 27
FEB 2
FEB 14
